content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
### Extraction System at position (-3.5, 27.5)
Consists of:
• Extraction burner inserter at (–3.5, 27.5) with drop position (–3.5, 28.5)
Use-case: Extracts raw resources for further processing.

### Copper Cable Factory at position (2.5, 17.5)
Consists of:
• Cable factory input chest at (2.5, 17.5)
• Factory burner inserter at (3.5, 17.5) placed using direction RIGHT
  – Connected with a burner inserter at (2.5, 16.5), a wooden chest at (2.5, 17.5) and an assembling-machine-1 at (1.5, 19.5)
Use-case: Provides the interface for processing raw materials into copper cable.

### Belt Depot at position (3.5, 15.5)
Consists of:
• Wooden chest at (3.5, 15.5) serving as the depot
• Adjacent transport belt segment at (4.5, 15.5)
• Depot burner inserter at (3.5, 14.5) placed using direction UP 
  – With pickup position (3.5, 15.5) and drop position (3.5, 13.5)
Use-case: Acts as an isolated belt depot for transferring items from the extraction system to the production network.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Transport Belt Connection Errors  
 – When connecting transport belts, ensure that the target entity is not a Prototype.SteamEngine. Use an inserter as the intermediary target to avoid repeated connection failures.

• Wooden Chest Placement Errors  
 – Confirm that the player is within the allowable placement range before attempting to place a wooden chest.  
 – Verify that the wooden chest is available in the inventory to prevent placement failures due to missing items.

• Undefined Variable Error  
 – Ensure that all variables (for example, target_chest) are correctly defined before use to avoid NameErrors.
